alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 2:45PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Platte and southeastern Converse Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 245 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Glendo, or 14 miles southeast of Douglas, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Platte and southeastern Converse Counties, including the following locations... Lost Springs. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 112 and 130. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern and east central Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; North Laramie Range
